Posts.Content: Does anyone know of a good women's deodorant that doesn't cause breast cancer?  I'm not saying that all deodorant does cause cancer, I just want to start using one that does not have parabens or harsh chemicals that are known to cause cancer?
Posts.Title: Deodorant

Posts.Content:
Just got my biopsy results!  Benigh!  I know I am one of the lucky ones for now anyway!  Wow! Did that 
open my eyes to the anxiety and stress of not knowing and waiting and waiting for test results.  I know the statistics are high......I also drink decaf coffee and try to take care of myself....but frankly, I don't know if it really matters.  I think random....no one causes breast cancer.....you either will get it or you won't.  My heart goes out to everyone waiting for test results or getting cancer!  Take care of yourselves and live life to the fullest....I had myself burried so many times; leaving my young children; leaving my hsuband to care for them by himself (we have almost no family--and the little we do have are old and not capable of childcare--that scared the living daylights out of me)!  All the posts of living long, and longevity were very encouranging though!  Thank you for this forum and anyone that answerred my posts.  Life for me will go on until the next mammo?  Scarry!
Posts.Title: Do I have anything to be worried about?? Because i am WORRIED!

Posts.Content: I love green tea actually...drink it almost every day.  I am actually English too; born there but am an American citizen and have been here since I was 5 yrs of age!  Good luck with everything.  Say your prayers and enjoy life.  Take good care of yourself.
Posts.Title: Do I have anything to be worried about?? Because i am WORRIED!

Posts.Content:
This all really is awful isn't it.  I am 43 and have a 9 yr daughter and 11 yr son.....I just had a biopsy done.  It's not too bad...it's totally bearable so don't worry too much about
 that.  I am waiting myself for results today or tomorrow.  I am 50/50 and know that I will be freaking out.  As with all mothers, our family needs us and we do so many things that we don't have time to deal with these things....but we must....we must take care of ourselves, somehow we must put ourself first.  I am really thinking of you and your predicatment.  What state do you live in.  That is awful how they gave you the news like that.......I guess they are being honest....there is not much customer service in the medical field these days......they don't realize the anxiety, stress of waiting for appts, waiting for results, waiting for the doctor to talk to you, EVERYTHING!  I know it's business as usual for everyone in the medical field, but they really do need to know.  On the other hand, no one has really given me any sort of information like they gave you...I don't know if that is good or bad...I feel like they are hiding something, not wanting to scare me, but in the meantime, I am scared, and worried, and stressed, and trying to carry on with day to day.  Hang in there.  It does help to surf the internet for websites and get all the information to arm yourself.  I freak out and then when I go on the internet, it calms me a little and arms with so much information.  I also do have a breast specialist/surgeon in the back of my mind, just in case my results are cancer......don't know when they can get me in, but I do have some names and are ready to go and battle this.  God bless you for dealing with this.  You are not alone, we are all in the same boat some way, some how on this website....let us know how you are doing in the future.
Posts.Title: Lesion found on mammogram

Posts.Content:
You are so very kind to respond to my post.  Wow!  You have been through a lot.  I can't believe you waited 3 weeks to get your biopsy....what were the results?  Why did you have to have surgery?....to get rid of a lump?  I am so glad you are doing well......I wish you the best for your next mammo.  It is such a worry, I know.  I am trying not to make myself go crazy, but inside I am while raising a 11 yr son and 9 yr daughter meanwhile not letting them know about
 my anxiety.  I am just hoping that if they find something that it is in the very beginning stages and can be treated.  I am not ready to leave my kids motherless and that makes me scared.  I have 7 more days until my biopsy and it's just not fun waiting.  Does anyone know anything to do in the meantime.  I am trying to educate myself by surfing the web and empowering myself!  God bless you for responding.  Thank you.  Do let know what your next mammo results are?  80% are benigh right?  We have to keep thinking that for all women and hoping modern technology will save us from our fears and be good for all of us.  Take care.
Posts.Title: (No Subject)

Posts.Content:
You are absolutely right....it IS worrying about
 the kids.  You would think with computers and all technology they could have results immediately these days...or at least within 24 hours or something like that.  Hmmmm....something for someone to invent and be rich!  Just like DNA was not invented and now it's revolutionary, we need equipment that gives results faster for everyone's tests...whatever they maybe.  Thank you for responding.  I am looking forward to having my procedure......that is what I am telling myself.....it's the 3 days later supposedly until the results come in that I am worried about
!  God bless you all......then you see someone like Whitney Houston with an 18 yr daughter who loves and needs her mother, take her life with drugs.....sad, very sad!  But let's ALL be hopeful that the statistics are on our side and 80% benigh, right?  Take care.
Posts.Title: (No Subject)

Posts.Content:
Is anyone nervous out there about
 an upcoming procedure?  I have to have a biopsy done in 9 days.  Is this usual for them to make someone wait.  The waiting is awful.  I guess I will find out something 3 days afterwards, but even the 9 days leading up is somewhat stressful.  I am nervous.  Just when I think I'm doing okay my mind keeps wondering and I picture my kids (only 9 and 11) without their mother....I picture my funeral, I picture so many horrible things for them too go through without me.  Help!  Why do hopsitals make people wait for (it was 11 days) for the procedure?
Posts.Title: (No Subject)

Posts.Content:
God bless you Barkyboys!!!!!!!!!!!!  My heart goes out to you as I know my imagination ran wild for the last several weeks as well about
 funerals and motherless kids!  I am relieved to tell you that I got a benign result yesterday from my doctor's nurse as they knew I was worried like every women does when going through this....however, I am yet to talk to the doctor himself and will today...I have so many questions.  Even though I dodged a bullet, I know that I have many more years to worry ahead of me and for my 9 yr daughter today esp knowing breast cancer statistics.  I don't have any family (only a sister who is not close with me and a mom that is mentally disabled due to a car accident) so that it made it hard also!  I hope they find a cure for breast cancer for all us women!
Posts.Title: (No Subject)

Posts.Content: I know the waiting is awful.....I don't have a lot of experience yet myself with any of this, but I also had a mammo, then a second mammo, then ultrasound and now I am finally going to get my biopsy tomorrow (waiting 10 days on pins and needles for this day to come).  I am 43 and have an 11 yr old and 9 yr old.  I am actually very anxious to get the procedure done and over....not scared of the procedure, just scared of the results.  All my report said is that I have a bigger density than last year and they want to see what it is...I'm glad they are being cautious and I want to know, too!  If I was you, I would definately request a biopsy or find a doctor that agrees with you....I don't want to wait for 6 mos.  80% of biopsies are benigh, but just not knowing is what is terrible.  I will find out my results in 2-3 days after tomorrow!  I feel something in there and it doesn't feel right, so I am thinking I have something and I want to know.  Good luck....I will check back for any comments as to what you decide.  Take care.....Isn't Bev great!!  She responded to my earlier post, too, and was the only one......!   It makes you feel like someone is listening and you are not alone.  Benign, benign, right!
Posts.Title: Do I have anything to be worried about?? Because i am WORRIED!

Posts.Content: I don't know much yet, and am waiting for results myself in 10 days....but I think you are doing an awesome job of taking care of yourself and seeing doctors and have a history of benigh things in your body....I have a gut feeling that you are going to be okay once again!  I know it's important to stay positive during the wait time...but I think you will be just fine.
Posts.Title: I'm scared! Multiple findings. My fear is that I have late stage invasive cancer.
